thread.title: Red grouper season closing in federal waters
thread.title_full: Red grouper season closing in federal waters

title: Red grouper season closing in federal waters
text:
Red grouper season closing in federal waters Chris Phillips, News Journal correspondent 7:53 p.m. CDT October 7, 2015 A crew of happy anglers after a day of grouper fishing aboard the charter boat Nothin’ Matters with Captain Jake Adams out of Day Break Marina. (Photo: Special to the News Journal) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The recreational harvest of red grouper in the Gulf of Mexico federal waters will close at 12:01 a.m. today and remain closed until January 1, 2016. 
According to NOAA Fisheries, red grouper catches in early 2015 were substantially higher than the same time period in previous years. 
Florida state waters in the Gulf of Mexico are from shore to nine nautical miles out and federal waters extend from where state waters end, out to about two hundred nautical miles. 
Earlier this year NOAA Fisheries reduced the bag limit to two fish with the intent to extend the fishing season for the entire year, but the 2015 landings data indicate the 1,900,000-pound recreational annual catch limit has been met. 
Hunter’s safety course 
The Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission is offering local hunters another opportunity to complete the required hunter’s safety course. 
Anyone born on or after June 1, 1975, must pass an approved hunter safety course and have a hunting license to hunt alone. The FWC course satisfies hunter-safety training requirements for all other states as well. 
Students must complete the internet course available at myfwc.com before attending this class and will need to bring a copy of the final report. 
Instruction will be held Oct. 15 from 6 to 10 p.m. at the Molino Community Center located off Highway 95A. The final step to complete the course is the gun range portion that will be Oct. 17 from 7 to 10 a.m. 
People interested in attending this course can register online at myfwc.com/huntersafety or by calling hunter safety coordinator Will Burnett at 265-3676. Read or Share this story: http://on.pnj.com/1LiSHvK TOP VIDEOS
